intro: Randia densiflora var. tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin randia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam and southern China. The plant is characterized by its dense, often hairy foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a glossy surface.
